verses.roman:
yaḥ priyārtham utaṅkasya
dhundhu-nāmāsuraṁ balī
sutānām eka-viṁśatyā
sahasrair ahanad vṛtaḥ

synonyms: yaḥ—he who; priya-artham—for the satisfaction; utaṅkasya—of the great sage Utaṅka; dhundhu-nāma—of the name Dhundhu; asuram—a demon; balī—very powerful (Kuvalayāśva); sutānām—of sons; eka-viṁśatyā—by twenty-one; sahasraiḥ—thousands; ahanat—killed; vṛtaḥ—surrounded.
translation: To satisfy the sage Utaṅka, the greatly powerful Kuvalayāśva killed a demon named Dhundhu. He did this with the assistance of his twenty-one thousand sons.
